AA.name: Blue Cipher Ring
AA.description: Item for online play. Puts the wearer in ready state to answer should someone in another world call for rescue. You will be summoned to their world as a hunter. When summoned to rescue another player, your objective will be to defeat the invader.
AA.effect: Enables the wearer to answer calls for rescue

Aa.name: White Cipher Ring
Aa.description: Item for online play. Allows you to automatically request for a hunter from another world to come to your rescue when your world is invaded. (You may be unable to summon rescuers under certain circumstances). A lost mystic code, enchanted to take the form of a ring. One of the fetishes said to have been bestowed by the Two Fingers.
Aa.effect: When invaded, request the aid of a hunter.

AB.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
AB.description: Item for online play. Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
AB.effect: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs

Ab.name: Tarnished's Furled Finger
Ab.description: Item for online play. Creates a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer. Your objective will be to defeat the area boss of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

Ac.name: Duelist's Furled Finger
Ac.description: Item for online play. Creates a summon sign for competitive multiplayer. Your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. A finger of corpse wax, furled like a hook. The bronze adornments are the mark of a duelist.

AD.name: Memory Of Grace
AD.description: A phantom vision of the first grace, which once guided the Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace at which you rested. It all repeats. Be seen by the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
AD.effect: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace.

Ad.name: Tarnished's Wizened Finger
Ad.description: Item for online play. (Can also be used from the Messages menu.) Use to write messages. Your messages will be conveyed to other worlds, allowing other players to read them. A finger of corpse wax, so emaciated the bone is visible. It is a relic of those who came before, left to help those who would come after.

AE.name: Taunter's Tongue
AE.description: Item for online play. Lures in invaders. This allows your world to be invaded without any Furled Finger cooperators present, and it also shortens the interval between windows of opportunity for invasion. Additionally, enables the arrival of a second invader. (When two invaders are present, you will be limited to one cooperator.)

Ae.name: Bloody Finger
Ae.description: Item for online play. Attempts an invasion of another player's world. If successful, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned. The nail of this finger is shot through with streaks of fresh, glistening blood. The finger's sickly pale skin feels nothing now, but the nail still aches with sweetest pain.
Ae.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world.

AF.name: Small Golden Effigy
AF.description: Online multiplayer item. Sends a summon sign for cooperative multiplayer to a nearby summoning pool. In cooperative multiplayer, you will be summoned to another world to help defeat the area boss.
AF.effect: Send co-operative sign to summoning pool

Af.name: Small Red Effigy
Af.description: Item for online play. Sends a competitive sign to a nearby summoning pool. In competitive multiplayer, your objective will be to defeat the Host of Fingers of the world to which you were summoned.
Af.effect: Sends competitive sign to summoning pool

AG.name: Festering Bloody Finger
AG.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world

Ag.name: Smithing Stone [3]
Ag.description: Stone used to smith a variety of armaments. A particularly hard specimen.

AH.name: Smithing Stone [2]
AH.description: Stone used to smith a variety of armaments. A large shard found in plenty. Strengthens armaments up to +6. Smithing stone is found throughout the Lands Between, and mining galleries built to excavate it can be found everywhere

Ah.name: Smithing Stone [4]
Ah.description: Stone used to smith a variety of armaments. A large and particularly hard specimen.

AI.name: Smithing Stone [5]

AK.name: Ancient Dragon Smithing Stone
AK.description: Smithing stone made polishing a golden Gravel Stone. A scale of the Ancient Dragonlord, and hidden treasure of Farum Azula

Ak.name: Somber Smithing Stone [1]
Ak.description: Shard of smithing stone drained of color. Strengthens special armaments to +1. Special armements with unique characteristics cannot be strengthened with colored smithing stones. Number of steps and amount strengthened differ from standard equipment.

AL.name: Somber Smithing Stone [2]

AP.name: Recusant Finger
AP.effect: Attempts invasion of other player's world

AQ.name: Grave Glovewort [1]
AQ.description: White flower that blooms in catacombs. Each a soundless bell used to summon spirits. Strengthens ashes to +1. The art of strengthening ashes is known as spirit tuning. only a spirit tuner may perform this deed.

Aq.name: Grave Glovewort [2]
Aq.description: White flower that blooms in catacombs. Each a soundless bell used to summon spirits. Strengthens ashes to +2. Spirit tuning is not merely the simple act of imbuing strength. It is an art that lies somewhere between tuning an instrument and conducting a conversation, leaving both parties enriched.

aX.name: Perfumer's Cookbook [4]
aX.description: A record of crafting techniques left by a depraved perfumer. Contains perilous techniques no ordinary physician would attempt.

ax.name: Ancient Dragon Apostle's Cookbook [1]
ax.description: A record of crafting techniques taught by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Details techniques that harness lightning, the weapon of the ancient dragons.

aY.name: Ancient Dragon Apostle's Cookbook [2]
aY.description: A record of crafting techniques taught by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Details techniques that harness lightning, the weapon of the ancient dragons. Acquire the knowledge to craft the following: -Lightning Pots -Roped Lightning Pots

aZ.description: A record of crafting techniques taught by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Details techniques that harness lightning, the weapon of the ancient dragons. Acquire the knowledge to craft the following: - Ancient Dragonbolt Pot - Lightningproof Dried Liver

az.name: Flask Of Crimson Tears
az.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with crimson tears, this flask restores HP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

a1.name: Flask Of Cerulean Tears
a1.description: A sacred flask modelled after a golden holy chalice that was once graced by a tear of life. Filled with cerulean tears, this flask restores FP with use. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that a Finger Maiden will bestow two such chalices upon the chosen Tarnished when they meet.

a2.name: Scriptstone
a2.description: Ruin fragment inscribed with letters.  Craftable item. Reveals additional messages from other worlds. Words are gregarious things, drawn to one another much as people are.
a2.effect: Reveals more messages from other worlds

a3.name: Holy Water Pot
a3.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order.
a3.effect: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict holy damage

a4.name: Rainbow Stone
a4.description: Ruin Fragment that has undergone some simple processing.
a4.effect: Shines with colored light when placed, serving as a guide

a5.name: Roped Fire Pot
a5.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
a5.effect: Throw behind to inflict fire damage.

a6.name: Rowa Raisin
a6.effect: On horseback, feed to spectral steed to restore HP

a7.name: Glowstone
a7.description: Polished Ruin Fragment that shines brighter than a Rainbow Stone. Craftable item. Emits light from the location it is placed, illuminating surroundings. However, the effect is short-lived, and it lacks the diverse colors of rainbow stones. May serve some benefit in dark places, or at night.
a7.effect: Emits a faint light from the location it is placed

a8.name: Pauper's Rune
a8.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of The Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold. Use to gain a few runes. For all that they may be feeble things, these runes will act as nourishment for the development of any Tarnished. Provided a Finger Maiden can be found...
a8.effect: Use to gain a few runes

a9.name: Flask Of Wondrous Physick
a9.description: A relic of the physick chemists, priests of the Erdtree. Harnesses the powers of crystal tears, which only form after the passage of many moons. Various specials effects are bestowed upon the drinker, dependent on the specific mixture of crystal tears. Rest at a site of grace to replenish. It is said that in the Lands Between, pools of crystal tears amass at the bases of Minor Erdtrees.

BA.name: Immunizing Cured Meat
BA.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts immunity Higher immunity helps to mitigate the buildup of various poisons and scarlet rot

Ba.name: Pickled Turtle Neck
Ba.description: Turtle neck meat, pickled in a bitter medicinal solution.

BB.name: Fireproof Dried Liver
BB.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a flame-hued medical solution. Craftable item. Boosts fire damage negation for a short time, improving damage mitigation against attacks imbued with fire.
BB.effect: Boosts  Fire Damage Negation for a short time.

Bb.name: Drawstring Fire Grease
Bb.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item. A smallish lump with a short string attached. Quickly coats armament, inflicting fire damage. However, the effects are only brief.
Bb.effect: Quickly coats weapon, inflicting  Fire Damage

BC.name: Fire Pot
BC.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of incendiary materials is sealed inside.
BC.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict Fire Damage

Bc.name: Fire Grease
Bc.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of incendiary materials. Craftable item. Coats armament, adding fire damage to attacks. The effect last only for a short time.

BD.name: Neutralizing Boluses
BD.description: Green boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison ailment. Poison accumulates gradually, coming into effect once the threshold is reached. Poison ailment lowers HP in steady increments for a period.
BD.effect: Alleviates poison buildup and cures poison

Bd.name: Exalted Flesh
Bd.description: A lump of animal pickled in a medicinal solution mixed with fiery spices. Craftable item. Temporarily Boosts physical attack Considered a delicacy in the badlands, this invigorating repast was for the exclusive benefit of those who they called heroes.

BE.name: Sleep Pot
BE.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Filled with the incantations of St. Trina. Consumes FP. Throw at enemy to release a purple, soporific haze. Like a lullaby, or a quagmire, it irresistibly draws its victims down into sleep. Sweet dreams.

Be.name: Gold-pickled Fowl Foot
Be.description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item. Boosts the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies for a certain duration Since old times, the needy would scrape the meat clean even from a fowl's claw.
Be.effect: Boosts rune acquisition for a time (30%)

BF.name: Dragon Heart
BF.description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. It has a bizarre shape, mottled by gravel, and it continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
BF.effect: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.

Bf.name: Throwing Dagger
Bf.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict damage

BG.name: Stimulating Boluses
BG.description: Light-purple boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates buildup of sleep. Sleep accumulates gradually, causing sudden fogginess and loss of FP once the threshold is reached, even if it does not force the afflicted into true slumber. Take one of these into timely fashion to avoid such events.

Bg.name: Stanching Boluses
Bg.description: Red boluses made from cave moss Craftable item. Alleviates impending blood loss Blood loss escalates gradually, causing great damage once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such an event.

BH.name: Lands Between Rune
BH.description: Grace said to have once dwelled in the eyes of the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering residue of gold.

Bh.name: Golden Seed
Bh.description: A golden seed, found at the base of an illusory tree.
Bh.effect: Increases Sacred Flask's number of uses

BI.name: Bewitching Branch
BI.description: Tree branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold. Craftable item.
BI.effect: Uses FP to charm pierced enemy

Bi.name: Boiled Prawn
Bi.description: Boiled prawn meat. A prime specimen of plump and moist meat. True connoisseurs know how to keep from over-salting.
Bi.effect: Boosts physical damage negation for a time

BJ.name: Explosive Stone
BJ.description: A small stone with a smoldering core.
BJ.effect: Explodes when thrown, inflicting Fire Damage

Bj.name: Starlight Shards
Bj.description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale blue glow.

BK.name: Golden Rune [1]
BK.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
BK.effect: Use to gain a small number of runes

Bk.name: Golden Rune [2]
Bk.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
Bk.effect: Use to gain a small number of runes (400)

Bl.name: Golden Rune [6]
Bl.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;

BM.description: Grace that dwells Within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;

Bm.description: Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden
Bm.effect: Uses FP to temporarilty boost poise

BN.name: Blood Grease
BN.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of blood-red materials.

Bn.name: Frozen Raisin
Bn.effect: On horseback, feed to Torrent to vastly restore HP

BO.name: Glass Shard
BO.effect: Shard of filthy glass. Worthless rubbish

Bo.name: Fan Daggers
Bo.description: A set of five throwing knives bundled together.
Bo.effect: Thrown fanned-out knives at enemies to inflict damage

BP.name: Grace Mimic
BP.description: A fetish indicating the guidance of grace.
BP.effect: Light shows the path, but without order

Bp.name: Roped Holy Water Pot
Bp.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.
Bp.effect: Uses FP. Throw behind to inflict holy damage

BQ.name: Bone Dart
BQ.description: Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing. Craftable item.
BQ.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict damage

Bq.name: Gravity Stone Chunk
Bq.description: Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike.
Bq.effect: Uses FP to cause a gravitational explosion

BR.name: Gravity Stone Fan
BR.description: Shard of rock found in the wake of a meteorite strike.
BR.effect: Uses FP to emit fan-shaped gravitational shockwave

Br.name: Invigorating Cured Meat
Br.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item.

BS.name: Invigorating White Cured Meat
BS.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a red medicinal solution. Craftable item.

Bs.name: Kukri
Bs.description: A large knife used for throwing.
Bs.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up onset of blood loss

BT.name: Glintstone Scrap
BT.description: Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
BT.effect: Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt.

Bt.name: Large Glintstone Scrap
Bt.description: Large piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels.
Bt.effect: Break gem and use FP to produce many magic bolts

BU.name: Magic Grease
BU.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials.

Bu.name: Remembrance Of The Grafted
Bu.description: Remembrance of Godrick, the Grafted, hewn into the Erdtree.
Bu.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

BV.name: Rot Grease
BV.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials.

Bv.name: Rune Arc
Bv.description: A shard of the shattered Elden Ring.
Bv.effect: Grants the blessing of an equipped rune upon use

BW.name: Silver-pickled Fowl Foot
BW.description: Four-toed foot of a fowl, pickled in a silvery medicinal solution.

Bw.name: Spellproof Dried Liver
Bw.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a blue medicinal

BX.name: Warming Stone
BX.description: Ruin Fragment blessed with an incantation of the Two Fingers. Craftable item. Uses FP to generate warmth, continuously restoring the HP of those nearby. It's said that the Erdtree was once as warm as the gentle sun, and would gradually heal all who bathed in its rays.
BX.effect: Uses FP to continuously heal nearby allies

Bx.name: Sacred Tear
Bx.description: Blessing of the Erdtree, worshiped in the churches of all lands; this

BY.name: Furled Finger's Trick-mirror
BY.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
BY.effect: Take on appearance of a Host of Fingers

By.name: Host's Trick-mirror

By.effect: Take on appearance of a cooperator

BZ.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of fulminating materials. Craftable item. A short string is attached to this lump.
BZ.effect: Quickly coats armament, inflicting lightning damage.

Bz.name: Cuckoo Glintstone
Bz.description: Lump of broken glintstone enwreathed with magic power. A "faux sorcery"used by the Knights of the Cuckoo. Craftable item. Launched straight ahead, using FP. A magic bolt springs forth from the point of impact
Bz.effect: Uses FP to produce a magic bolt

B1.name: Preserving Boluses
B1.description: Scarlet boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item.
B1.effect: Alleviates scarlet rot buildup and cures rot

B2.name: Golden Rune [5]
B2.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.

B3.name: Remembrance Of The Full Moon Queen
B3.description: Remembrance of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, hewn into the Erdtree.
B3.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

B4.name: Raw Meat Dumpling
B4.description: A pungent raw meatball, made succulent by virtue of being on the verge of turning.
B4.effect: Restores HP but causes poison buildup

B5.name: Prattling Pate "wonderful"
B5.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Wonderful."

B6.name: Clarifying White Cured Meat
B6.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution. Craftable item.

B7.name: Immunizing White Cured Meat
B7.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a green medicinal solution.

B8.name: Clarifying Cured Meat
B8.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a purple medicinal solution. Craftable item. Temporarily boosts focus. Higher focus helps to mitigate the buildup of sleep and madness.

B9.name: Soft Cotton
B9.description: A soft but sturdy cotton formed from splitting open Rowa fruit in a particular manner. Craftable item.
B9.effect: Temporarily reduces fall damage and sound

bA.name: Poisonbone Dart
bA.description: Animal bone sharpened into a knife for throwing, with a poison-laced tip. Craftable item.
bA.effect: Throw at enemies to inflict damage and build up poison

ba.name: Poisoned Stone
ba.description: A small stone with a poisoned core.
ba.effect: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison

bB.name: Poisoned Stone Clump
bB.description: A clump of small stones with poison cores.
bB.effect: Throw together to cause buildup of poison

bb.name: Dragonwound Grease
bb.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of gravels stones. Craftable item.
bb.effect: Coats armament, granting special dragon attacks

bC.name: Prattling Pate "apologies"
bC.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Apologies."

bc.name: Rejuvenating Boluses
bc.description: Black boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item.

bD.name: Explosive Stone Clump
bD.description: A clump of small stones with smoldering cores.
bD.effect: Explodes when thrown together, inflicting fire damage

bd.name: Prattling Pate "you're Beautiful"
bd.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a demi-human head. Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful."
bd.effect: Emits a voice that says "You're beautiful"

bE.name: Poison Grease
bE.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of poison-green materials.

be.name: Prattling Pate "please Help"
be.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Please help."
be.effect: Emits a voice that says "Please help"

bF.name: Golden Rune [7]
bF.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.

bf.name: Golden Rune [9]
bf.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.

bG.name: Golden Rune [10]
bG.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.
bG.effect: Use to gain a great many runes

bg.name: Golden Rune [8]
bg.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between; the lingering trace of gold.

bH.name: Shield Grease
bH.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Craftable item.
bH.effect: Boosts guarding ability and all damage negation.

bh.name: Soap
bh.description: A plant-based soap made from mushroom juice. Craftable item.
bh.effect: Removes filth and accumulations on the body

bI.name: Frenzyflame Stone
bI.description: Ruin fragment blessed with an incantation of the Three Fingers. Craftable item.
bI.effect: Uses FP to continuously heal chaos followers

bi.name: Lightning Grease
bi.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of fulminating materials. Craftable item.

bJ.name: Soporific Grease
bJ.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of light-purple materials. Craftable item.

bj.name: Dappled Cured Meat
bj.description: Cured strip of meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution. Craftable item.
bj.effect: Temporarily boosts Immunity, Robustness, and Focus

bK.name: Wraith Calling Bell
bK.description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
bK.effect: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths

bk.name: Holyproof Dried Liver
bk.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in a golden medicinal solution. Craftable item.

bL.name: Remembrance Of The Starscourge
bL.description: Remembrance of Starscourge Radahn, hewn into the Erdtree.
bL.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

bl.name: Dappled White Cured Meat
bl.description: A white sliced meat, dried out after pickling in a dappled medicinal solution. Craftable item.
bl.effect: Temporarily boosts immunity, robustness, and focus

bM.name: Clarifying Boluses
bM.description: Yellow boluses made of cave moss. Craftable item. Alleviates madness buildup. Madness accumulates slowly, inflicting heavy damage and reducing FP once the threshold is reached. Take one of these in timely fashion to avoid such events.

bm.name: Crystal Dart
bm.description: Throwing knife chiseled from impure crystal. Craftable item. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to deal magic damage. Long ago, it is said that a golem crafter employed a similar crystal tool.
bm.effect: Uses FP. Throw to inflict magic damage.

bN.name: Drawstring Blood Grease
bN.effect: Quickly coats armament, inflicting blood loss

bn.name: Drawstring Magic Grease
bn.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials. Craftable item. A short string is attached to this lump. Quickly coats armament, inflicting magic damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.
bn.effect: Quickly coats armament, inflicting magic damage

bO.name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
bO.description: Item for online play. Craftable item. Reveals cooperative and competitive multiplayer signs. Co-op summoning signs will be shown in gold, while hostile summoning signs will be shown in red. Multiplayer begins when you summon a player from another world through their sign.
bO.effect: Reveals co-op and hostile summoning signs

bo.name: Roped Fetid Pot
bo.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
bo.effect: Throw behind to cause buildup of deadly poison

bP.name: Roped Poison Pot
bP.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to cause buildup of poison.
bP.effect: Throw behind to cause buildup of poison

bp.name: Beastlure Pot
bp.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted with assassin incantations. Consumes FP. Throw to create a red shadow. The illusion lures in beasts into attacking it. This effect does not change even during combat.

bQ.name: Roped Oil Pot
bQ.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot. Throw at rearward enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
bQ.effect: Throw behind to douse enemies in oil

bq.name: Rancor Pot
bq.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. Enchanted by the ancient death hex. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to spawn vengeful spirits that chase down foes. In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.
bq.effect: Uses FP. Throw to summon vengeful spirits.

bR.name: Cursed-blood Pot
bR.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Decorated with the crest of the Lord of Blood. Throw at enemies to douse them in accursed blood, causing summoned spirits to assail them with a rabid fervor. A childhood memory of the Lord of Blood.
bR.effect: Throw to douse enemy with accursed blood.

br.name: Freezing Pot
br.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Engraved with the crest of the Carian Royals. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost. Originates from the cold, dark moon of Ranni, the Carian princess.
br.effect: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of frost.

bS.name: Poison Pot
bS.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of poisonous materials is sealed inside. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.
bS.effect: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of poison.

bs.name: Oil Pot
bs.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of oil-infused materials is sealed inside. Throw at enemies to soak them in oil, making them heavily susceptible to fire damage.
bs.effect: Throw at enemies to soak them in oil.

bT.name: Poison Spraymist
bT.description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to release a poison mist from user's mouth, causing a buildup of poison. Perfumed powder is held in the mouth to dissolve before being expelled. It was once a restorative art, or so it is said.
bT.effect: Uses FP to release poison mist from the mouth.

bt.name: Fetid Pot
bt.description: Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot. A cocktail of effluents is sealed inside. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of deadly poison. Beware though; those who carry these pots will slowly accumulate poison in their own bodies. Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
bt.effect: Throw at enemies to cause deadly buildup of poison.

bU.name: Giantsflame Fire Pot
bU.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Giants' Flame. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage. Damage scales with faith.
bU.effect: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy fire damage.

bu.name: Bloodboil Aromatic
bu.description: Forbidden art of depraved perfumers. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor, raising maximum attack power and stamina while also increasing damage received. "Even upon the battlefield, do you fear being wounded? Take a good look. Your limbs are frozen stiff."
bu.effect: Uses FP to enter a temporary state of fervor.

bV.name: Thawfrost Boluses
bV.description: Ice-hued boluses made from cave moss. Craftable item.

bv.name: Remembrance Of The Naturalborn
bv.description: Remembrance of Astel, Naturalborn of the Void, hewn into the Erdtree.  The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes.
bv.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

bW.name: Remembrance Of The Regal Ancestor
bW.description: Remembrance of the Regal Ancestor Spirit, hewn into the Erdtree.
bW.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

bw.name: Margit's Shackle
bw.description: A fetish bathed in golden magic. Shackles were used to bind the accursed people called the Omen, and these ones were made to keep a particular Omen under strictest confinement. Though faint, the shackles still retain vestiges of power  enough to trap the once-bound Margit on earth, if only for a short time.
bw.effect: Binds Margit and Morgott two times per battle

bX.name: Numen'srune
bX.effect: Use to gain a multitude of runes

bx.name: Regal Omen Bairn
bx.description: Doll of a curseborn bairn from the Erdtree's royal line.  Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase down foes.
bx.effect: Uses FP to unleash many wraiths that chase that foes

bY.name: Sacred Order Pot
bY.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Enchanted by incantations of the Golden Order. Consumes FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage. Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, even preventing them from rising again. The Golden Order has no mercy for those who trespass beyond life's bounds.
bY.effect: Uses FP. Throw at enemies to inflict heavy holy damage.

by.name: Rot Pot
by.description: Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot. Decorated with the crest of scarlet wings. Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot.  The rot bubbles up from the Swamp of Aeonia, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.
by.effect: Throw at enemies to cause buildup of scarlet rot.

bZ.name: Spark Aromatic
bZ.description: Art of the perfumers who fought In the Shattering. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to broadly scatter sparks in a wide arc straight ahead. Though fire was prohibited to those who served the Erdtree, this rule was forgotten as the war drew ever on.
bZ.effect: Uses FP to broadly scatter sparks in a wide arc straight ahead

bz.name: Blasphemous Claw
bz.description: A slab of rock engraved with traces of the Rune of Death.
bz.effect: Deflects the power of the Black Blade

b1.name: Uplifting Aromatic
b1.description: An of the perfumers who fought in the Shattering. Craftable with a perfume bottle. Uses FP to raise the attack power of the user and nearby allies while also reducing the damage from one incoming attack by half. This aromatic has an extremely potent morale-raising effect that makes those accustomed to it fearless in the face of death. It was this influence that made the perfumers exceptional commanders.
b1.effect: Boosts ally attack power and reduces incoming damage once.

b2.name: Drawstring Holy Grease
b2.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials. Craftable item. A short string is attached to this lump. Quickly coats armament, inflicting holy damage, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.
b2.effect: Quickly coats armament, inflicting holy damage

b3.name: Freezing Grease
b3.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of frozen materials.

b4.name: Golden Rune [13]
b4.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
b4.effect: Use to gain a great many runes

b5.name: Hero's Rune [1]
b5.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
b5.effect: Use to gain an abundance of runes.

b6.name: Hero's Rune [5]
b6.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
b6.effect: Use to gain an abundance of runes.

b7.name: Lightningproof Dried Liver
b7.description: Cured animal liver, dried out after pickling in an yellow medicinal

b8.name: Lord's Rune
b8.description: Grace that dwells within the inhabitants of the Lands Between;
b8.effect: Use to gain an enormous abundance of runes

b9.name: Memory Of Grace
b9.description: A phantom vision of the first grace, which once guided the Tarnished to the Lands Between. Lose all runes and return to last site of grace at which you rested. It all repeats. Be seen by the Elden Ring. Become the Elden Lord.
b9.effect: Lose all runes, return to last site of lost grace.

CA.name: Mohg's Shackle
CA.description: A fetish bathed in golden magic.
CA.effect: Briefly binds Mogh, once imprisoned, to earth

Ca.name: Omen Bairn
Ca.effect: Uses FP to unleash wraiths that chase down foes

CB.name: Remembrance Of Hoarah Loux
CB.description: The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes
CB.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Cb.name: Remembrance Of The Black Blade
Cb.description: Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the
Cb.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

CC.name: Remembrance Of The Blasphemous
CC.description: Remembrance of the warrior I-Ioarah Loux, hewn into the
CC.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Cc.name: Remembrance Of The Fire Giant
Cc.description: Remembrance of Fire Giant, hewn into the Erdtree.
Cc.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

CD.name: Drawstring Rot Grease
CD.description: Solidified grease made from a mixture of rotten materials. Craftable item. A short string is attached to this lump. Quickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.
CD.effect: Quickly coats armament, inflicting scarlet rot, but with a brief effect, owing to its small size.

CE.name: Remembrance Of The Omen King
CE.description: Remembrance of Morgott, the Omen King, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Though born one of the graceless Omen, Morgott took it upon himself to become the Erdtree's protector. He loved not in return, for he was never loved, but nevertheless, love it he did.
CE.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Ce.name: Remembrance Of The Black Blade
Ce.description: Remembrance of Maliketh, the Black Blade, hewn into the Erdtree. The power of its namesake can be unlocked by the Finger Reader. Alternatively, it can be used to gain a great bounty of runes. Maliketh was a shadowbound beast given to his Empyrean. Marika's sole need of her shadow was a vessel to lock away Destined Death. Even then, she betrayed him.
Ce.effect: Take the power of its namesake Via Finger Reader

CF.name: Remembrance Of The Dragonlord
CF.description: Remembrance of Dragonlord Placidusax, hewn into the Erdtree.
CF.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Cf.name: Remembrance Of The Lichdragon
Cf.description: Remembrance of Lichdragon Fortissax, hewn into the Erdtree.
Cf.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

CG.name: Elden Remembrance
CG.description: Remembrance of the Elden Beast, hewn into the Erdtree.
CG.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

Cg.name: Remembrance Of The Rot Goddess
Cg.description: Remembrance of Malenia, Goddess of Rot, hewn into the Erdtree.
Cg.effect: Take the power of its namesake via Finger Reader

CH.name: Radiant Baldachin's Blessing
CH.description: Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity. Uses FP to temporarily raise poise. The effect lasts longer than a mere favor. It's said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
CH.effect: Uses FP to temporarily raise poise

Ch.name: Crafting Kit
Ch.description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools. Enables item crafting from the main menu. Provides both means to fight and means to survive.
Ch.effect: Enables the practice of item Crafting

CI.name: Telescope
CI.description: Astrology tool used by members of the Carian royal family. Part of a larger instrument, removed and stolen away. Allows the viewer to better see faraway things. During the age of the Erdtree, Carian astrology withered on the vine. The fate once writ in the night skies had been fettered by the Golden Order.
CI.effect: Allows viewer to see faraway things

Ci.name: Torch
Ci.description: This torch's tip is wrapped in oil-soaked rags and set on fire. The flame can illuminate dark locales, or used to attack enemies. Can be raised up when equipped in the left hand, illuminating more of the surrounding area.
Ci.type: Guard Phy 21 Mag 15 Fire 25 Ligt 15 Holy 15 Boost 19
Ci.effect: Phy 54 Mag 0 Fire 97 Ligt 0 Holy 0 Crit 100
Ci.obtainedFrom: Phy 21 Mag 15 Fire 25 Ligt 15 Holy 15 Boost 19

CJ.name: Lantern
CJ.description: A small waist-worn lantern that illuminates surroundings. Use once to turn on, and again to turn off. While its light is dimmer than that of a torch, it has the advantage of freeing up the user's hands.
CJ.effect: Attach to waist to illuminate surroundings

Cj.name: Spectral Steed Whistle
Cj.description: A delicate goldwork ring. Can be used as a finger whistle. Sound the whistle to summon and ride spectral steed. (Dismounts steed when used while on horseback.) Upon death, the spectral steed can be summoned again, but doing so consumes the Flask of Crimson Tears.
Cj.effect: Summon and ride spectral steed Torrent.

CK.name: Spirit Calling Bell
CK.description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.
CK.effect: Bell that summons various spirits from ashen items

Ck.name: Spirit Calling Bell
Ck.description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.
Ck.effect: Bell that summons various spirits from ashen items

CL.name: Tailoring Tools
CL.description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
CL.effect: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace

Cl.name: Sewing Needle
Cl.description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
Cl.effect: Boc the demi-human's prized sewing needle

CM.name: Tailoring Tools
CM.description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
CM.effect: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace

Cm.name: Golden Tailoring Tools
Cm.effect: Allows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace

CN.name: Gold Sewing Needle
CN.effect: Special sewing needle for demigod attire

Cn.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
Cn.description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold, snapped in half.
Cn.effect: Snapped intricate needle of unalloyed gold

CP.name: Talisman Pouch
CP.description: Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those atempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader.

Cp.name: Stonesword Key
Cp.effect: Use to break one imp statue seal

CQ.name: Academy Glintstone Key
CQ.description: Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
CQ.effect: Key to open the academy's two sealed gates

Cq.name: Sewer-gaol Key
Cq.description: Filthy key received from the Dung Eater.

CR.name: Rusty Key
CR.effect: Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle

Cr.name: Imbued Sword Key
Cr.description: Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic.
Cr.effect: Unseals sending gate, but disappears upon use

CS.name: Drawing-room Key
CS.description: Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room.
CS.effect: Key to the Volcano Manor drawing room

Cs.name: Hosts' Trick-mirror
Cs.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
Cs.effect: Take on appearance of a cooperator

CT.name: Mimic's Veil
CT.effect: Uses FP to mimic nearby objects.

Ct.name: Irina's Letter
Ct.description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within
Ct.effect: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne

CU.name: Discarded Palace Key
CU.description: A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh. Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses. It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.
CU.effect: Key to treasure chest for Carian Princesses

Cu.name: Furled Finger's Trick-mirror
Cu.description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
Cu.effect: Take on appearance of a Host of Fingers

CV.name: Irina's Letter
CV.description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne. Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within
CV.effect: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne

Cv.name: Chrysalids' Memento
Cv.description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.

CW.name: Chrysalids' Memento
CW.description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.

Cw.name: Beast Eye
Cw.description: Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman.
Cw.effect: Said to tremble when close to Deathroot

CX.name: Deathroot
CX.description: A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death.
CX.effect: Beast Clergyman seeks and devours these

Cx.name: Shabriri Grape
Cx.description: A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape.
Cx.effect: Yellow, oozing eyeball of the infirm

CY.name: Celestial Dew
CY.description: A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear.
CY.effect: Carry out Absolution at the Church of Vows

Cy.name: Seedbed Curse
Cy.description: Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.
Cy.effect: Curse grown on a body defiled by a Dung Eater

CZ.name: Black Knifeprint
CZ.description: On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers.
CZ.effect: Mark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual

Cz.name: Dragon Heart
Cz.description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. It has a bizarre shape, mottled by gravel, and it continues to beat vivaciously. An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours. While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.
Cz.effect: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar.

C1.name: Fingerprint Grape
C1.description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow.
C1.effect: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow

C2.name: Prattling Pate "hello"
C2.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.

C3.name: Prattling Pate "thank You"
C3.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head.
C3.effect: Emits a voice that says "Thank you"

C4.name: Prattling Pate "apologies"
C4.description: Twisted clay sculpt in the shape of a human head. Emits a voice that says "Apologies."

C5.name: Wraith Calling Bell
C5.description: Bell used by worshippers of revenants.
C5.effect: Uses FP to ring bell and calls prowling wraiths

C6.name: Larval Tear
C6.description: Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear.
C6.effect: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth

C7.name: Seluvis's Potion
C7.description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.
C7.effect: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis

C8.name: Mirage Riddle
C8.description: A riddle concerning a rise that vanishes like a mirage.
C8.effect: Simple map taken from an imp statue.

C9.name: Valkyrie's Prosthesis
C9.description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm. When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.
C9.effect: Golden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie

cA.name: Weathered Dagger
cA.description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
cA.effect: Dagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion

ca.name: Seluvis's Introduction
ca.description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms.
ca.effect: Letter of introduction addressed to Sellen

cB.name: Lost Ashes Of War
cB.description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.

cb.name: Fingerslayer Blade
cb.description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.
cb.effect: Hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron

cC.name: Ancestral Infant's Head
cC.description: Skull of a very young ancestral spirit. Just think how many sproutings It might bear.
cC.effect: Uses FP to spray spirit vapor

cc.name: Carian Inverted Statue
cc.description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.
cc.effect: Key revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall

cD.name: Cursemark Of Death
cD.description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
cD.effect: Cursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh

cd.name: Rold Medallion
cd.description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak. Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants. The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.

cE.name: Miniature Ranni
cE.description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch.

ce.name: The Stormhawk King
ce.description: Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other. This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.
ce.effect: Ashes of a hawk which heeds no summons.

cF.name: Dark Moon Ring
cF.description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.
cF.effect: Ring of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath

cf.name: Dectus Medallion (right)
cf.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
cf.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

cG.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (left)
cG.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
cG.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

cg.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (right)
cg.description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree. Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path. In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.
cg.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold

cH.name: Assassin's Prayerbook
cH.description: Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins.
cH.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

ch.name: Dectus Medallion (left)
ch.description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
ch.effect: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus

cI.name: Fire Monks' Prayerbook
cI.description: Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north.
cI.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

ci.name: Dragon Cult Prayerbook
ci.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult.
ci.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

cJ.name: Two Fingers Prayerbook
cJ.description: Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers. An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship.
cJ.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

cj.name: Conspectus Scroll
cj.effect: Give to Sorceress Sellen to unlock Glintstone Cometshard and Star Shower

cK.name: Ancient Dragon Prayerbook
cK.description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between.
cK.effect: Give to a learned cleric to acquire new incantations

ck.name: Royal House Scroll
ck.description: Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
ck.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

cL.name: Academy Scroll
cL.description: Scroll of the Academy of Raya Lucaria, the glintstone sorcerers' place of study.
cL.effect: Give to a learned sorcerer to acquire new sorceries

cl.name: Whetstone Knife
cl.description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
cl.effect: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons

cM.name: Glintstone Whetblade
cM.description: Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
cM.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

cm.name: Iron Whetblade
cm.description: Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
cm.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

cN.name: Whetstone Knife
cN.description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
cN.effect: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons

cn.name: Black Whetblade
cn.description: Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
cn.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon

cO.name: Sancrified Whetblade
cO.description: Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife. When applying an affinity using physical or golden-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of sacred or lightning can be chosen.
cO.effect: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon.

co.name: Map (limgrave, West)
co.description: Map of the western region of Limgrave. The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.

cP.name: Map (limgrave, East)
cP.description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.

cr.name: Map (dragonbarrow)
cr.effect: Reveals the region of Dragonbarrow on the map.

cS.name: Map (liurnia, West)
cS.effect: Reveals the western portion of Liurnia on your map.

cs.name: Map (ainsel River)
cs.description: Map of Ainsel River and environs
cs.effect: Map of Ainsel River and environs

cT.name: Map (siofra River)
cT.description: Map of Siofra River and environs
cT.effect: Reveals the region of Siofra River on the map.

cU.name: Map (altus Plateau)
cU.description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs. The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.
cU.effect: Reveals  Altus Plateau on your map

cu.name: Map (leyndell, Royal Capital)
cu.description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.
cu.effect: Reveals the region of Leyndell on the map.

cV.name: Map (caelid)
cV.effect: Reveals the region of Caelid on the map.

cv.name: Map (mountaintops Of The Giants, West)
cv.description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants. Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.
cv.effect: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.

cW.name: Map (mountaintops Of The Giants, East)
cW.description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants. The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.
cW.effect: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.

cw.name: Map (consecrated Snowfield)
cw.description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs. The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.
cw.effect: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.

cX.name: Map (lake Of Rot)
cX.description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs. A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.
cX.effect: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.

cx.name: Note (land Squirts)
cx.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about land squirts.

cY.name: Map (deeproot Depths)
cY.description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs. At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.
cY.effect: Revels Deeproot Depths and environs on your map

cy.name: Note (stonedigger Trolls)
cy.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant. Contains information about stonedigger trolls.

cZ.name: Note (flask Of Wondrous Physick)
cZ.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant.

cz.name: Note (waypoint Ruins)
cz.description: A note sold by a nomadic merchant.

c1.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
c1.description: A special crystallization formed within a tear of life over the course of many moons. Causes concoction to explode when taken in mixed physick. A dangerous form of crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.
c1.effect: Causes concoction to explode in mixed physick

c3.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
c3.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
c3.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina in mixed physick

c4.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
c4.description: A special crystallization formed over the course of many moons within a tear of life, a blessing of the Erdtree. Can be mixed in a flask of wondrous physick. The resulting concoction restores 20 half of one's max FP.
c4.effect: Restores half of total FP in mixed physick.

c5.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
c5.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
c5.effect: Eliminates all FP consumption in mixed physick

c6.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
c6.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum HP.
c6.effect: Restores half of total HP in mixed physick

c7.name: Crimsonburst Crystal Tear
c7.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's
c7.effect: Steadily restores HP for a time in mixed physick

c8.name: Faith-knot Crystal Tear
c8.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's faith.
c8.effect: Temporarily boosts faith in mixed physick

c9.name: Strength-knot Crystal Tear
c9.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
c9.effect: Temporarily boosts strength in mixed physick

DA.name: Opaline Bubbletear
DA.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DA.effect: Significantly negates damage in mixed physick

Da.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
Da.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Da.effect: Enhances charged attacks for a time in mixed physick

DB.name: Dexterity-knot Crystal Tear
DB.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DB.effect: Temporarily boosts dexterity in mixed physick

Db.name: Lightning-shrouding Cracked Tear
Db.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Db.effect: Temporarily boosts lightning attacks in mixed physick

DC.name: Magic-shrouding Cracked Tear
DC.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DC.effect: Temporarily boosts magic attacks in mixed physick

Dc.name: Winged Crystal Tear
Dc.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Dc.effect: Temporarily reduces equip load in mixed physick

DD.name: Holy-shrouding Cracked Tear
DD.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DD.effect: Temporarily boosts holy attacks in mixed physick

Dd.name: Twiggy Cracked Tear
Dd.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
Dd.effect: Briefly stop rune loss on death in mixed physick

DE.name: Leaden Hardtear
DE.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DE.effect: Temporarily boosts poise in mixed physick

De.name: Crimsonspill Crystal Tear
De.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum HP.
De.effect: Temporarily boosts max HP in mixed physick

DF.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
DF.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction gradually restores stamina recovery speed.
DF.effect: Temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed in mixed physick.

Df.name: Speckled Hardtear
Df.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.
Df.effect: Boosts resistance and heals status in mixed physick.

DG.name: Flame-shrouding Cracked Tear
DG.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.
DG.effect: Temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

Dg.name: Crimson Bubbletear
Dg.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction automatically heals one's HP in the moment before death. However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.
Dg.effect: Restores HP when near death in mixed physick.

DH.name: Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear
DH.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction converts incoming damage into recovered HP instead. However, physical damage cannot be converted. This effect is only brief and will quickly expire.
DH.effect: Converts damage received into HP in mixed physick.

Dh.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
Dh.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.
Dh.effect: Makes consecutive attacks grow stronger in mixed physick.

DI.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
DI.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DI.effect: Make attacks more likely to break enemy stances in a mixed physick

Di.name: Windy Crystal Tear
Di.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction increases the effectiveness of dodgerolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.
Di.effect: Enhances dodge rolls for a time in mixed physick

DJ.name: Opaline Hardtear
DJ.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.
DJ.effect: Temporarily boosts all damage negations in physick

Dj.name: Purifying Crystal Tear
Dj.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the age where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground. Can be mixed in the Flask of Wonderous Physick. The resulting conction purifies the curse from Mohg, Lord of Blood's terrifying rite of blood.
Dj.effect: Purifies the Lord of Blood's curse in a mixed physick

DK.name: Aeonian Butterfly
DK.description: A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the swamp of Aeonia. Material used for crafting items.

Dk.name: Albinauric Bloodclot
Dk.description: The thick, coagulated blood of the Ablinaurics. Material used for crafting items.

DL.name: Intelligence-knot Crystal Tear
DL.description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
DL.effect: Temporarily boosts intelligence in mixed physick.

Dl.name: Altus Bloom
Dl.description: A golden-tingerd flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Material used for crafting items.

DM.name: Arteria Leaf
DM.description: Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A faint pulse can be felt in the veins. Stirs the blood, providing an enlivening effect.

Dm.name: Beast Liver
Dm.description: The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. Dried liver boost damage negation.

DN.name: Beast Blood
DN.description: Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Material used for crafting items.

Dn.name: Bloodrose
Dn.description: Blood-slick roses that bloom in festering blood. Material used for crafting items.

DO.name: Blood-tainted Excrement
DO.description: The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty. Mixed inside with half-digested flesh are dense colonies of tiny eggs of unknown but assuredly revolting origin.

Do.name: Budding Cave Moss
Do.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. Material used for crafting items.

DP.name: Cave Moss
DP.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves. Material used in crafting items. A fundamental ingredient for medicinal boluses.
DP.obtainedFrom: Gives off pale light in dark caverns.

Dp.name: Cracked Crystal
Dp.description: A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Material used for crafting items

DQ.name: Crystal Cave Moss
DQ.description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Material used for crafting items.

Dq.name: Budding Horn
Dq.description: A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

DR.name: Crab Eggs
DR.description: Eggs of lare crabs which dwell in the shallows. Materials used for crafting items.

Dr.name: Cracked Pot
Dr.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.
Dr.effect: Container required for crafting cracked pot items

DS.name: Ritual Pot
DS.description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.
DS.effect: Container required for crafting ritual pot items

Ds.name: Crystal Bud
Ds.description: A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

DT.name: Dewkissed Herba
DT.description: A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

Dt.name: Eye Of Yelough
Dt.description: A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Material used for crafting items.

DU.name: Erdleaf Flower
DU.description: A dusky-yellow flower that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items.

Du.name: Faded Erdleaf Flower
Du.description: An Erdleaf flower that has faded into a plate scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

DV.name: Fire Blossom
DV.description: A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the mountaintops of the Giants. Material used for crafting items.

Dv.name: Flight Pinion
Dv.description: Flight feather of a bird of prey. Material used for crafting items. Commonly used for arrow fletchings.

DW.name: Formic Rock
DW.description: Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Material used for crafting items.

Dw.name: Four-toed Fowl Foot
Dw.description: Foot of a four-toed fowl. Material used for crafting items. In the Lands Between, having three digits is seen as a bad omen. As such, the rarer four-toed fowl's is a gift of great luck indeed.

DX.name: Fulgurbloom
DX.description: Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands. Material used for crafting items. Imbued with traces of lightning's essence.

Dx.name: Glintstone Firefly
Dx.description: A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Material used for crafting items.

DY.name: Glintstone Scrap
DY.description: Piece of glintstone tinged with unstable magic. Found in crystal tunnels. Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt. Poor quality and thereby easily broken, a sorcerer wouldn't give it a second look.
DY.effect: Break gem, using FP to produce a magic bolt.

Dy.name: Gold Firefly
Dy.description: Firefly that gives off a golden light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of water close to Minor Erdtrees. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Golden light is considered to invite runes.

DZ.name: Gold-tinged Excrement
DZ.description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Often hidden in woods and thickets. Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.
DZ.obtainedFrom: Often hidden in woods and thickets.

Dz.name: Golden Centipede
Dz.description: The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede.

D1.name: Golden Dung
D1.description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.

D2.name: Golden Rowa
D2.description: A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Material used for crafting items.

D3.name: Golden Sunflower
D3.description: A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

D4.name: Grave Violet
D4.description: A purple flower than blooms in graveyards. Material used for crafting items.
D4.obtainedFrom: At Liurnia of The Lakes' graves.

D5.name: Gravel Stone
D5.description: A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Material used for crafting items.

D6.name: Great Dragonfly Head
D6.description: Head of a large dragonfly. Material used for crafting items. Long believed to have the ability to neutralize poisons.

D7.name: Herba
D7.description: Evergreen leaves that give off a faith light. Material used for crafting items. This very common medicinal plant can be found in thickets and elsewhere.

D8.name: Hidden Plumage
D8.description: Rarely-seen dark plumage found inside the wing. Material used for crafting items. Death's bearers were once said to have taken the form of birds, symbolized by these black feathers.

D9.name: Human Bone Shard
D9.description: Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.

dA.name: Living Jar Shard
dA.description: A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Material used for crafting items.

da.name: Lump Of Flesh
da.description: A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beast. Meat suitable for a rustic feast.

dB.name: Land Octopus Ovary
dB.description: Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus. Material used for crafting items. Land octopuses eat humans in order to bear young, and theirs is the blood that runs through these ovaries.

db.name: Melted Mushroom
db.description: A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

dC.name: Miquella's Lily
dC.description: A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items. Exeedingly rare to find.

dc.name: Miranda Powder
dc.description: Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Material used for crafting items.

dD.name: Moon Egg
dD.description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items. Prized as a symbol of the most sublime slumber.

dd.name: Old Fang
dd.description: A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang.

dE.name: Mushroom
dE.description: A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Its thick, spongy flesh makes it a key component in throwing pots.
dE.obtainedFrom: Thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere.

de.name: Perfume Bottle
de.description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.
de.effect: Container required for crafting perfume items

dF.name: Poisonbloom
dF.description: Flower that grows in toxic terrain. Material used for crafting items. Poisonous, but may also provide the cure.

df.name: Nascent Butterfly
df.description: An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

dG.name: Rimed Crystal Bud
dG.description: A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

dg.name: Rimed Rowa
dg.description: A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. Material used for crafting items. Found in frigid highlands.

dH.name: Root Resin
dH.description: Resin secreted from the roots of the Great tree. Material used in crafting items. The roots of the Great tree drive far and wide through the earth of the Lands Between. They were once entwined with the roots of the Erdtree, or so they say.
dH.obtainedFrom: Secreted from the roots of the Greattree. Can also be found near trees on the surface.

dh.name: Rowa Fruit
dh.description: Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs. Material used for crafting items. Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between, it is primarily used in preserved foods.
dh.obtainedFrom: Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between.

dI.name: Ruin Fragment
dI.description: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies. These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.

di.name: Sacramental Bud
di.description: An immature bud containing fresh blood. Material used for crafting items.

dJ.name: Sanctuary Stone
dJ.description: A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Material used for crafting items.

dj.name: Slumbering Egg
dj.description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items.

dK.name: Smoldering Butterfly
dK.description: An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items. Serves as the kindling for a number of items.

dk.name: String
dk.description: Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.

dL.name: Silver Firefly
dL.description: Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of cold water untouched by sunlight. The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Silver light is considered to invite riches.
dL.obtainedFrom: Found near cold waters untouched by sunlight.

dl.name: Sliver Of Meat
dl.description: A slice of thinly carved beast flesh. Material used for crating items. Found by hunting herbivorous beast. The dried meat toughens the constitution.

dM.name: Strip Of White Flesh
dM.description: Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature. Material used for crafting items. The dried meat toughens the constitution, boosting resistance. It's known for its long-lasting effect.
dM.obtainedFrom: Found by hunting creatures devoid of blood.

dm.name: Tarnished Golden Sunflower
dm.description: A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

dN.name: Toxic Mushroom
dN.description: A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

dn.name: Trina's Lily
dn.description: A pale purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. A symbol of faith in St. Trina. Dulls the senses, preventing agitation.

dO.name: Thin Beast Bones
dO.description: Thin, hard beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting beasts.

do.name: Turtle Neck Meat
do.description: A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat. Material used for crafting items. Turtle meat is said to boost virility, but none in the Lands Between seem to have much appetite for it these days. In Lands Between, the urge to reproduce has waned long ago.

dP.name: Volcanic Stone
dP.description: A smoldering rock containing hot gas.

dp.name: Yellow Ember
dp.description: An ember taken from an eye socket of a corpse. Material used for crafting items.

dQ.name: Hefty Beast Bone
dQ.description: Thick, solid beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting particularly large beasts. Commonly Used to make disposable weapons.

dq.name: Silver Tear Husk
dq.description: A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items. The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...

dR.name: Stormhawk Feather
dR.description: A feather from a hawk that lived as one with the storms. Material used for crafting items. These feathers, enveloped in swirling winds, are often used for arrow fletching.
